job_details.Vacaturetitel: Senior Backend Engineer, Create: Code Creation (EMEA)
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
* Advocate for improvements to product quality, security, and performance that have particular impact across your team.
     * Solve technical problems of high scope and complexity.
     * Exert influence on the overall objectives and long-range goals of your team.
     * Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent these problems.
     * Help to define and improve our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale web environment. Maintain and advocate for these standards through code review.
     * Represent GitLab and its values in public communication around broader initiatives, specific projects, and community contributions.
     * Provide mentorship for Junior and Intermediate Engineers on your team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy.
     * Confidently ship moderately sized features and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projects.
     * Improves the engineering projects at GitLab as a project maintainer. For more information regarding timelines and exceptions, see this page., The team at GitLab is dedicated to fostering a collaborative and innovative development environment. They actively contribute to creating high-quality code, emphasizing best practices and continuous improvement. For a detailed insight into their processes and workflows, you can explore the team's handbook pages here (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/development/dev/create/code-creation/) . This resource provides a comprehensive guide to their approach in code creation, including coding standards, code review processes, and collaborative development practices. Joining this team means being part of a culture that values excellence, open communication, and the ongoing evolution of development methodologies

   How GitLab will support you
     * Benefits to support your health, finances, and well-being (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/total-rewards/benefits/general-and-entity-benefits/)
     * All remote (https://about.gitlab.com/company/culture/all-remote/guide/) , asynchronous (https://about.gitlab.com/company/culture/all-remote/asynchronous/) work environment
     * Flexible Paid Time Off (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/paid-time-off/)
     * Team Member Resource Groups
     * Equity Compensation & Employee Stock Purchase Plan (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/stock-options/)
     * Growth and development budget (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/total-rewards/benefits/general-and-entity-benefits/#growth-and-development-benefit)
     * Parental leave (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/total-rewards/benefits/general-and-entity-benefits/#parental-leave)
     * Home office (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/finance/procurement/office-equipment-supplies/) support

   Please note that we welcome interest from candidates with varying levels of experience; many successful candidates do not meet every single requirement. Additionally, studies have shown that people from underrepresented groups (https://about.gitlab.com/company/culture/inclusion/#examples-of-select-underrepresented-groups) are less likely to apply to a job unless they meet every single qualification. If you're excited about this role, please apply and allow our recruiters to assess your application.

   Country Hiring Guidelines: GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.

   Privacy Policy: Please review our Recruitment Privacy Policy. (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/hiring/candidate/faq/recruitment-privacy-policy/) Your privacy is important to us.
job_details.full_text:
Senior Backend Engineer, Create: Code Creation (EMEA)

* Advocate for improvements to product quality, security, and performance that have particular impact across your team.
     * Solve technical problems of high scope and complexity.
     * Exert influence on the overall objectives and long-range goals of your team.
     * Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent these problems.
     * Help to define and improve our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale web environment. Maintain and advocate for these standards through code review.
     * Represent GitLab and its values in public communication around broader initiatives, specific projects, and community contributions.
     * Provide mentorship for Junior and Intermediate Engineers on your team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy.
     * Confidently ship moderately sized features and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projects.
     * Improves the engineering projects at GitLab as a project maintainer. For more information regarding timelines and exceptions, see this page., The team at GitLab is dedicated to fostering a collaborative and innovative development environment. They actively contribute to creating high-quality code, emphasizing best practices and continuous improvement. For a detailed insight into their processes and workflows, you can explore the team's handbook pages here (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/development/dev/create/code-creation/) . This resource provides a comprehensive guide to their approach in code creation, including coding standards, code review processes, and collaborative development practices. Joining this team means being part of a culture that values excellence, open communication, and the ongoing evolution of development methodologies

   How GitLab will support you
     * Benefits to support your health, finances, and well-being (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/total-rewards/benefits/general-and-entity-benefits/)
     * All remote (https://about.gitlab.com/company/culture/all-remote/guide/) , asynchronous (https://about.gitlab.com/company/culture/all-remote/asynchronous/) work environment
     * Flexible Paid Time Off (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/paid-time-off/)
     * Team Member Resource Groups
     * Equity Compensation & Employee Stock Purchase Plan (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/stock-options/)
     * Growth and development budget (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/total-rewards/benefits/general-and-entity-benefits/#growth-and-development-benefit)
     * Parental leave (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/total-rewards/benefits/general-and-entity-benefits/#parental-leave)
     * Home office (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/finance/procurement/office-equipment-supplies/) support

   Please note that we welcome interest from candidates with varying levels of experience; many successful candidates do not meet every single requirement. Additionally, studies have shown that people from underrepresented groups (https://about.gitlab.com/company/culture/inclusion/#examples-of-select-underrepresented-groups) are less likely to apply to a job unless they meet every single qualification. If you're excited about this role, please apply and allow our recruiters to assess your application.

   Country Hiring Guidelines: GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.

   Privacy Policy: Please review our Recruitment Privacy Policy. (https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/hiring/candidate/faq/recruitment-privacy-policy/) Your privacy is important to us.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on backend engineering principles, code quality, performance optimization, mentorship, and collaboration within a software development environment. It does not mention any specific generative AI models, frameworks, or techniques, nor does it involve tasks directly related to building or fine-tuning AI models. The role appears to be a traditional software engineering position, not a specialized AI role.

job_tasks.justification: The description emphasizes 'advocate for improvements to product quality, security, and performance', 'solve technical problems of high scope and complexity', 'define and improve our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale web environment', 'Maintain and advocate for these standards through code review', and 'ship moderately sized features and improvements'. These are all core aspects of software development.
job_tasks.phrase: Advocate for improvements to product quality, security, and performance

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions 'Solve technical problems of high scope and complexity', which is a fundamental aspect of software engineering.
job_tasks.phrase: Solve technical problems of high scope and complexity

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Exert influence on the overall objectives and long-range goals of your team' relates to the strategic impact of a software engineer within a team.
job_tasks.phrase: Exert influence on the overall objectives and long-range goals of your team

job_tasks.justification: The description highlights 'Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent these problems', which are key concerns in software engineering for scalable systems.
job_tasks.phrase: Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent these problems

job_tasks.justification: The role involves defining and improving standards for 'style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale web environment' and enforcing them through 'code review', which are standard software development practices.
job_tasks.phrase: Help to define and improve our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale web environment. Maintain and advocate for these standards through code review.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Represent GitLab and its values in public communication around broader initiatives, specific projects, and community contributions' indicates a need for external communication.
job_tasks.phrase: Represent GitLab and its values in public communication around broader initiatives, specific projects, and community contributions

job_tasks.justification: The description states 'Provide mentorship for Junior and Intermediate Engineers on your team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy', which involves problem-solving and guiding others.
job_tasks.phrase: Provide mentorship for Junior and Intermediate Engineers on your team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy

job_tasks.justification: The ability to 'Confidently ship moderately sized features and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members' and 'Collaborate with the team on larger projects' are core software development responsibilities.
job_tasks.phrase: Confidently ship moderately sized features and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projects.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves improving 'engineering projects at GitLab as a project maintainer', which is a software development task.
job_tasks.phrase: Improves the engineering projects at GitLab as a project maintainer

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions 'fostering a collaborative and innovative development environment' and 'open communication', which are soft skills related to teamwork.
job_tasks.phrase: fostering a collaborative and innovative development environment

job_tasks.justification: The emphasis on 'continuous improvement' and 'ongoing evolution of development methodologies' points to a need for learning and adaptation.
The phrase 'take initiative' is not explicitly mentioned, but 'advocate for improvements', 'solve problems', and 'ship features' imply a degree of ownership and proactive contribution.

soft_skills.phrase: Represent GitLab and its values in public communication around broader initiatives, specific projects, and community contributions
Provide mentorship for Junior and Intermediate Engineers on your team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy
fostering a collaborative and innovative development environment
ship moderately sized features and improvements with minimal guidance and support
